Key Match Events: Michael Siani hit a tiebreaking two-run single in the 12th inning.
Ryan Helsley pitched two innings for the win, striking out four.
Paul Goldschmidt homered for St. Louis and has a 10-game hitting streak.
Jackson Chourio and Joey Ortiz connected for the NL Central-leading Brewers.
Willy Adames hit a two-out RBI double in the 11th for Milwaukee.
Steven Matz pitched 4 2/3 innings for the Cardinals in his first big league game since April 30.
Post-Match Reflections: St. Louis manager Oliver Marmol praised the team's mentality and overall effort.
Milwaukee manager Pat Murphy credited St. Louis pitching for their performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Siani was playing in his second game since missing nearly a month with a right oblique strain.
Marmol and third base coach Daniel Descalso were ejected in the fourth by home plate umpire Lance Barrett for arguing balls and strikes.

Brewers: LHP Hoby Milner was reinstated from the injured list. RHP Bryse Wilson (right oblique strain) was placed on the 15-day IL. LHP Bryan Hudson was optioned to Triple-A Nashville, and Peguero was recalled from the minors.
